titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Peace and Social Justice Program (PSJ), Governance and Civil Society, Senior Program Officer, Office Files of Michael Lipsky
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Peace and Social Justice Program (PSJ), Governance and Civil Society, Senior Program Officer, Office Files of Michael Lipsky FA725

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2015-08-26 19:58:21 -0400.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Peace and Social Justice Program (PSJ), Governance and Civil Society, Senior Program Officer, Office Files of Michael Lipsky

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Material is open for scholarly research, with prior archival review.
Material more than ten years old is open for scholarly research.
Select individual files are restricted, as noted. Permission to access these files must be obtained from the Ford Foundation before scholarly access is permitted.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Completion of a use agreement is required prior to providing scholarly access. See RAC Head of Reference (or applicable designee) for details.
Ford Foundation holds title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection for scholarly purposes. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.

appraisal.head: Appraisal
appraisal.p: Box 43136 has not been deposited at, or otherwise transferred to, RAC.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files and officers papers were transferred to, and accessioned by, RAC beginning in 2011. Accessions continue as necessary.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Level 1 Minimal Processing has been conducted to establish basic intellectual and physical control of the material and assess immediate preservation and conservation needs. Material remains as received, in original folders and storage boxes.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Materials requiring specialized equipment for access (film, audio, video, slides) may be restricted from scholarly research dependent on availability of the applicable equipment.
Brittle or damaged items, or materials otherwise in need of preservation care, may be restricted from scholarly research at the discretion of the RAC Head of Archival Services/RAC Head of Reference.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The following reports were transferred to the Ford Foundation Archives Reports Collection. The number on the left is the assigned call number. The reports are listed alphabetically by author. Please consult the Research Center catalog for access.

did.unittitle: Hair, Penda D. "Race, Ethnicity and Access to Democracy: A Report to the Ford Foundation."
Hispanic Federation of New York City. "The Latino Leadership Fund Progress Report 1991-1992 to the Ford Foundation and the New York Community Trust."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a memo from Luis A. Miranda Jr., President of the Hispanic Federation of New York City. The memo summarizes the different initiatives related to the Latino Leadership Fund

did.unittitle: Tendler, Judith. "The Peace and Social Justice Program: Goals, Expected Outcomes and Results. A Report to the Ford Foundation."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a letter to Tendler from M. Lipsky with comments on the report.

did.unittitle: Walker, Tobi. "Service and Politics: The Lost Connection" prepared for the Ford Foundation. May 30, 2000, corrected June 27, 2000.
